comments:
I don't know how but my workspace got corrupted and I cooldn't start eclipse.
The error I got 

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -1
	at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEWorkbenchAdvisor.refreshFromLocal(IDEWorkbenchAdvisor.java:474)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEWorkbenchAdvisor.postStartup(IDEWorkbenchAdvisor.java:211)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runUI(Workbench.java:1520)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.createAndRunWorkbench(Workbench.java:257)
	at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createAndRunWorkbench(PlatformUI.java:139)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEApplication.run(IDEApplication.java:90)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:277)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:239)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:117)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:267)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:692)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:676)

After examining the workspace metadata I found that the error was the attached
workspace.xml. I removed the corrupted file and eclipse started ok.

I am using Eclipse M8 with Sun JRE 1.4.2_02
Created an attachment (id=9575)
Corrupted workspace.xml
Yahsu,

There were a couple of problems here:
1. If after restoring the previous state there are no windows open, the
workbench should open the default one.  It was failing to do this.
2. refreshLocal was assuming there was at least one window.

Is there anything in your .log indicating how the workbench.xml got corrupted in
the first place?
Hi there,
Thanks for the quick reply!

Unfortunately I erased the log file so I don't know what exactly corrupted my
workbench.xml file. But are some clues to help you investigate it.

I tried to open a file in a third party editor.
Eclipse reported a serious error and suggested to me to restart the workbench.

When I pressed the x button to shutdown Eclipse the eclipse window dissapeared
but eclipse was still running.
I noticed that only when I tried to logoff (then the workspace save progress bar
appeard).
When I logged on and tried to open eclipse again it couldn't start.

There is a similar posting in the newsgroups (eclipse.platform) copying...

Subject: M8: killed it, now it won't start
Had a JUnit tests that ran out of memory, and eclipse stopped responding.
Had to kill javaw in the task manager (windows XP).

Now it won't start again.  When I try to start it, a javaw process
initializes to about 32MB, then nothing.

.metadata/.log has no new errors after my OutOfMemory from this morning, no
pop-up-window with a message.  If I try to start it again (which usually
gives the "already got eclipse running" error, I get an error telling me
that it cannot connect to the workspace.
Thanks for the additional info.  Not sure what the problem was on shutdown, but
the "phantom eclipse" on startup would be explained by it failing to open the
first time window if it could not restore any.  It would just come up and sit
there with no windows.
BTW, what part of Greece are you from? Back in 1999 I had a wonderful trip
there, mainly sailing around the Dodecanese.
Unfortunately I live in Athens. Dodecanese are great and I would like to be able
to live there. But it's hard to find work as a programmer in these places.

It must be great working for eclipse.org! I wish I could do that as my primary job.
